properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Chokoloskee to Bonita Beach FL out 20 NM; Coastal waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee FL out 20 NM
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 1 at 1:46PM EST by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Coastal waters from Marco Island to Wilderness Waterway South out 20 NM...

At 144 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated showers, capable of producing
winds to around 30 knots. These showers were located along a line
extending from 14 nm east of T Tower to 6 nm southeast of D Tower to
22 nm east of P Tower, moving northeast at 35 to 40 knots.

Locations impacted include...
Chokoloskee, Shark Point, Big Lostmans Bay, Chevelier Bay, Cape
Romano Aquatic Preserve, Cape Romano, D Tower, Highland Point and
Marco Island.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots and locally higher
waves. Boaters should seek safe harbor immediately until these
showers pass.

Waterspouts are possible with this activity. Remain on the alert in
case warnings are issued for waterspout development.

NWSheadline: STRONG SHOWERS OVER THE SOUTHERN NEAR-SHORE WATERS OF COLLIER COUNTY AND NORTHERN NEAR-SHORE WATERS OF MAINLAND MONROE COUNTY
